nycTheatreExcerpt: "Yet you will likely have more fun at Boop! than in many other theaters this spring; this is an old-fashioned stage-frolic filled show, with big songs and bigger dancing, including roof-raising numbers overseen by director/choreographer Jerry Mitchell, with the company tap-dancing and high-kicking in perfect rows of synchronized movement. If you desire sheer escapismand I can't imagine why, the world being just peachy right nowthis show is for you."

llmScore.reasoning: [two-model-fallback] | Both models agree: Positive | Claude: The critic clearly recommends the show for entertainment value, praising the dancing, songs, and escapist appeal, though the single excerpt limits confidence in the overall verdict. | Gemini: The review suggests the show is enjoyable and fun, especially compared to other shows, but the phrase 'If you desire sheer escapism' implies it might not be for everyone or the most artistically fulfilling experience.
